Emergency Blood Availability Tracker ðŸ©¸
A real-time web application that helps people find matching blood types during medical emergencies by connecting donors, hospitals, and patients in need.

Problem Statement
During medical emergencies, people struggle to find matching blood types. Our project aims to build a real-time dashboard that shows available donors/hospitals with specific blood types nearby, based on location.

Features
Real-time Blood Availability Tracking: Live updates of blood stock across hospitals

Comprehensive Donor Registration: Multi-step screening process with health assessment

Hospital Portal: For hospitals to update blood inventory

Location-based Search: Find donors/hospitals by proximity

Emergency Alerts: Notify nearby donors during critical shortages

Multi-language Support: Accessibility for diverse users

Backend: Node.js, Express.js

Database: MongoDB

Version Control: GitHub

CI/CD: Jenkins

Containerization: Docker

Orchestration: Kubernetes

Cloud Deployment: AWS

Testing Tools: Selenium, Postman, Manual Testing

Donor Registration Process
1. Personal Details
<img src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a67cc44e-14be-4d5b-9de3-2bbcc732f90a" width="400" alt="Personal Details Section">
Full Name: Complete legal name of the donor

Contact Information: Email and phone number for communication

Demographics: Age, gender, and blood type

Physical Attributes: Height and weight (minimum 45kg requirement)

2. Health Information
<img src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca4b61cf-f583-425b-9d26-c1c6bf2af23a" width="400" alt="Health Information Section">
Medical Conditions: Diabetes, smoking habits, and chronic illnesses

Vital Statistics: Hemoglobin count and blood pressure

Disease History: Comprehensive medical history screening

Current Symptoms: Active health issues assessment

3. Medical History & Identification
<img src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e0c64a4-e4b8-4e4c-ae10-64ee6d643651" width="400" alt="Medical History Section">
Surgical History: Recent surgeries or blood transfusions

Infection Risk Assessment: Hepatitis, Malaria, HIV/AIDS screening

ID Verification: Government-issued identification proof

Donation History: Previous blood donation experience

4. Location Preferences & Declaration
<img src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/452697a3-1f8d-4c28-8876-9056a4776fef" width="400" alt="Location Preferences Section">
Donation Centers: Preferred locations for blood donation

Availability: Days and times convenient for donation

Legal Declaration: Health eligibility confirmation

Data Accuracy: Information verification commitment
